name: Glen Alden Coal Company v. Anthracite Miners of Pennsylvania et al., Appellants
name_abbreviation: Glen Alden Coal Co. v. Anthracite Miners

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Glen Alden Coal Company v. Anthracite Miners of Pennsylvania et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
From the suggestion filed since the argument of this case and from admissions appearing in the answer to the suggestion, we are satisfied that the questions raised by the appeal are moot. The appeal is therefore dismissed without prejudice, each party to pay its own costs.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: E. C. Marianelli, with him James M. Stack, John E. Morris, Jr., and Edgar W. Lare, for appellants.
John P. Kelly, with him Evan C. Jones, Gilbert S. McClintock, Reese H. Harris and J. H. Oliver, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Glen Alden Coal Company v. Anthracite Miners of Pennsylvania et al., Appellants.
June 29, 1935:
Argued April 4, 1935;
reargued April 17, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
E. C. Marianelli, with him James M. Stack, John E. Morris, Jr., and Edgar W. Lare, for appellants.
John P. Kelly, with him Evan C. Jones, Gilbert S. McClintock, Reese H. Harris and J. H. Oliver, for appellee.
